MODE_CHANGED_BODY: {{prayer}} will be used for your next prayer.
SHARE_DESC: Pray The Rosary, Embrace Mercy, Anywhere {{url}}.
NEW_SESS_ERR: Could not start new prayer session.
CONGRATS: May your prayers be heard and answered in Jesus' name. Amen.
HOME_DIVINE_MERCY_CONTENT: From His Heart flowed blood and water ‚Äî An ocean of mercy poured out for the world. In this hour of need and grace, draw near to the compassion. The Divine Mercy is not only a prayer, but a refuge for sinners, a light for the dying, and a balm for every weary soul.
HOME_HOLY_ROSARY_CONTENT: She who pondered all things in her heart now walks beside you in prayer. Through joyful mysteries and sorrowful tears, glorious triumphs and luminous light, The rosary is her gentle call to dwell with her Son. Take her hand  ‚Äî and let each Hail Mary be a step toward Heaven.
PROM_FULL: Fifteen Promises Made By The Blessed Virgin To Those Who Recite Her Rosary

WC.P1: RosaryGo is your quiet companion for praying the Holy Rosary and Divine Mercy ‚Äî offline, ad-free, and always with you.
WC.P2: Set your preferences, including mode, language, and  theme in the menu. Tap ‚ÄúPray The ‚Ä¶‚Äù to begin, you can finish any day, any time. Follow each bead at your own pace using the ‚ÄúNext‚Äù buttons. Your prayers and intentions are locally stored in ‚ÄúPrayer History‚Äù for future reflection, and you can click on any to delete it.

PROM.P1: To all who will recite my Rosary devoutly I promise my special protection and very great graces.
PROM.P2: Those who will preserve in the recitation of my Rosary shall receive some signal graces.
PROM.P3: The Rosary shall be a very powerful armpit against hell, it shall destroy vice, deliver from sin, and shall dispel heresies.
PROM.P4: The Rosary shall make virtue and good work flourish, and shall obtain for souls the most abundant divine mercies; it shall substitute in hearts love of God for love of the world, elevate them to desire eternal goods, oh, that souls would sanctify themselves by this means!
PROM.P5: This who entrust themselves to me through the Rosary shall not perish.
PROM.P6: Those who would recite my Rosary piously, considering its mysteries, shall not be overwhelmed by misfortune nor die a bad death. The sinner shall be worthy of eternal life.
PROM.P7: Those truly devoted to my Rosary shall not die without the consolation of the Church, or without grace.
PROM.P8: Those who will recite my Rosary shall find during their life and at their death the light of God and the fullness of his grace and shall share in the merits of the blessed.
PROM.P9: I will deliver very promptly from purgatory the souls devoured to my Rosary.
PROM.P10: The true children of my Rosary, you shall enjoy great glory in heaven.
PROM.P11: What you shall ask through the Rosary, you shall obtain.
PROM.P12: Those who propagate my Rosary shall obtain through me aid in all their necessities.
PROM.P13: I have obtained from my son that all their confreres  of the Rosary shall have for their Brethren in life and death the saints of Heaven.
PROM.P14: Those who recite my Rosary faithfully are all my beloved children and brothers and sisters of Jesus Christ.
PROM.P15: Devotion to my Rosary is a special sign of predestination.

MYSTERIES.DESC_0_0: The angel said to Mary, "You shall conceive and bear a son and give him the name Jesus. And he will be called Son of the Most High." Luke 1:31, 32
MYSTERIES.DESC_0_1: "Blessed are you among women and blessed is the fruit of your womb. Blessed is she who trusted that the Lord‚Äôs word to her would be fulfilled." Luke 1:42, 45
MYSTERIES.NAME_0_2: The Nativity of our Lord Jesus
MYSTERIES.DESC_0_2: While Mary and Joseph were in Bethlehem, she gave birth to her first-born son and wrapped him in swaddling clothes and laid him in a manger. Luke 2:6, 7
MYSTERIES.NAME_0_3: The Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
MYSTERIES.DESC_0_3: When the day came to purify them according to the law of Moses, Mary and Joseph brought Jesus up Jerusalem so that he could be presented to the Lord. Luke 2:22
MYSTERIES.NAME_0_4: The Finding of the Child Jesus in the Temple
MYSTERIES.DESC_0_4: They came upon him in the temple sitting in the midst of teachers listening to them and asking them questions.  All who heard him wee amazed. Like 2:46, 47
MYSTERIES.DESC_1_0: The Spirit descended like a dove on him and a voice came from heaven, "You are my Son, the beloved; and with you I am well pleased." Mark 1:10
MYSTERIES.DESC_1_1: Jesus changed water into wine at the wedding in Cana, the first of his signs, and revealed his glory; and his disciples believed in him. John 2:11
MYSTERIES.DESC_1_2: "The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God has come bear; repent, and believe in the good news." Mark 1:15
MYSTERIES.DESC_1_3: And he was transfigured before them, and his face shone like the sun, and his clothes became dazzling white. Matthew 17:2
MYSTERIES.DESC_1_4: He took bread, gave thanks, broke it and gave it to them, saying. "This is my body which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of me" Luke 22:19
MYSTERIES.DESC_2_0: Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane. He advanced a little and fell prostrate in prayer: "My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass me by." Matthew 26:36, 39
MYSTERIES.DESC_2_1: The people said, "Let his blood be upon us and upon our children." At that, he released Barabbas to them. Jesus, however, he first had scourged. Matthew 27:25, 26
MYSTERIES.DESC_2_2: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him, and after twisting some thorns into a crown, they put it on his head‚Ä¶ saying "Hail, King of the Jews!" Matthew 27:28, 29
MYSTERIES.DESC_2_3: Jesus was led away, and carrying the cross by himself went out to what is called the place of the skull. There they crucified him. John 19:17, 18
MYSTERIES.DESC_2_4: The curtain in the sanctuary was torn into two. Jesus uttered a loud cry and said, "Father, into your hands I commend my spirit." After this he expired. Luke 23:45, 46
MYSTERIES.DESC_3_0: The angel spoke, "Do not be frightened. I know you are looking for Jesus the crucified, but he is not here. He has been raised, exactly as promised." Matthew 28:5, 6
MYSTERIES.DESC_3_1: He then led them out near Bethany, and with hands upraised, he blessed them, as he blessed them, he left them and was taken up to heaven. Luke 24:50, 51
MYSTERIES.NAME_3_2: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
MYSTERIES.DESC_3_2: Tongues of fire  appeared which parted and came to rest on each of them. All were filled with the Holy Spirit. Acts 2:3, 4
MYSTERIES.DESC_3_3: May you be blessed, my daughter, by God most high, beyond all women on earth; and may the Lord God be blessed, the Creator of heaven and earth. Judith 13:18
MYSTERIES.DESC_3_4: A great sign appeared in the sky, a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet and on her head a crown of twelve stars. Revelation 12:1

PRAY.SIGN: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, Amen.
PRAY.COME_HOLY_V: Come, Holy Spirit, fill the hearts of thy faithful.
PRAY.COME_HOLY_R: And enkindle in them the fire of thy love.
PRAY.SEND_FORTH_V: Send forth thy spirit and they shall be created.
PRAY.SEND_FORTH_R: And thou shall renew the face of the earth.
PRAY.LUP1: O God, who by the light of the Holy Spirit, did instruct the hearts of the faithful, grant that in the same spirit we may be truly wise and ever rejoice in his consolation, through Christ our Lord. Amen
PRAY.THOU_O_V: Thou O Lord shall open my lips.
PRAY.THOU_O_R: And my tongue shall proclaim they praise.
PRAY.INCLINE_UNTO_V: Incline unto my aid O God
PRAY.INCLINE_UNTO_R: O Lord make hast to help me.
PRAY.DOXOLOGY_V: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit;
PRAY.DOXOLOGY_R: As it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be, world without end. Amen.
PRAY.CREED_R: I believe in God, the Father Almighty, Creator of heaven and earth, and in Jesus Christ, His only Son, who was conceived by the Holy Spirit, born of the Vrigin Mary, suffered under Pontius Pilate, was crucified, died, and was buried: he descended into hell; on the third day he rose again from the dead; he ascended into heaven, seated at the right hand of God, the Father Almighty; from there he will come to judge the living and the dead. I believe in the Holy Spirit, the holy Catholic Church, the communion of saints, the forgiveness of sins, the resurrection of the body, and life everlasting. Amen.
PRAY.OUR_FATHER_V: Our Father, Who art in Heaven, hallowed be Thy name; Thy KIngdom come, Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
PRAY.OUR_FATHER_R: Give us this day our daily bread; and forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us; and lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. Amen.
PRAY.HAIL_MARY_V: Hail Mary, full of grace, the Lord is with thee, blessed art though amongst women and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus.
PRAY.HAIL_MARY_R: Holy Mary Mother of God, pray for us sinners now and at the hour of our death. Amen.
PRAY.FATIMA_R: O my Jesus, Forgive us our sins. Save us from the fires of hell. Lead all souls into heaven, especially those who are in most need of thy mercy. Amen.
PRAY.HAIL_HOLY_R: Hail! Holy Queen, Mother of Mercy; hail, our life, our sweetness and our hope. To you do we cry, poor banushed children of Eve, to you do we send up our sighs, mourning and weeping in this valley of tears. Turn then. O most gracious advocate, your eyes of mercy towards us, and after this our exile, show unto us the blessed fruit of your womb, Jesus, O clement, O loving, O sweet Virgin Mary.
PRAY.PRAY_FOR_V: Pray for us O holy Mother of God
PRAY.PRAY_FOR_R: That we may be made worthy of the promises of Christ.
PRAY.LUP2: O God, Whose only-begotten Son, by His life, death and resurrection, has purchased for us the rewards of eternal salvation: grant, we beseech You, that meditating upon these mysteries in the most holy Rosary of the Blessed Virgin Mary, we may imitate what they contain, and obtain what they promise. Through the same Christ our Lord. Amen
PRAY.LITANY: Litany of the Blessed Virgin Mary

LITANY_CONT.V6: God, the Son, Redeemer of the world.
LITANY_CONT.A49: Queen of the most holy Rosary,
LITANY_CONT.LAMB: Lamb of God, you take away the sins of the world,
LITANY_CONT.LUP: Grant, we beseech Thee, O Lord, that we your servants may enjoy perpetual health of mind and body; and, by the glorious intercession of the blessed Mary ever Virgin, may be delivered from present sorrows, and attain to eternal joy. Through Christ our Lord. Amen.

PRAY.ETERNAL_FATHER_R: Eternal Father, I offer You the Body and Blood, Soul and Divinity of Your dealy Beloved Son, our Lord Jesus Christ, in atonement of our sins and those of the whole world.
PRAY.FOR_THE_V: For the sake of his sorrowful passion,
PRAY.FOR_THE_R: have mercy on us and on the whole world.
PRAY.HOLY_GOD_R: Holy God, Holy Mighty One, Holy Immortal One, have mercy on us and on the whole world.
PRAY.LUP3: Eternal God, in whom mercy is endless and the treasury of compassion ‚Äî inexhaustible, look kindly upon us and increase Your mercy in us, that in difficult moments we might not despair nor become dospondent, but with great confidence submit ourselves to Your holy will, which is love and mercy itself.
